cve_list.title: IBM DLM null pointer dereference vulnerability
cve_list.description: In the Linux kernel, a vulnerability was resolved in the function do_uevent which returned a positive value to event_done. This caused new_lockspace to undo operations and leave lockspace unset. Due to commit 8511a2728ab8, __dlm_new_lockspace treated it as success. Later, device_create_lockspace passed NULL to dlm_find_lockspace_local, resulting in a null pointer dereference (NPD). Fixing the return handling prevents the crash without breaking userspace behavior.

cve_list.title: D-Link DIR-619L Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
cve_list.description: A buffer overflow exists in the formSetWizard2 function of D-Link DIR-619L firmware 2.04B04. It is triggered by manipulating the curTime argument. The attack can be launched remotely. This vulnerability affects end-of-life products and will not be patched.

cve_list.title: Patch My PC Home Updater DLL Search Path Manipulation
cve_list.description: Patch My PC Home Updater <= 5.1.3.0 is affected by DLL search path hijacking involving critical Windows system libraries. A local attacker can exploit this to load malicious DLLs. The vendor did not respond to the disclosure. The exploit has been made public.
